ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I worked with the mod lab to conduct effort and beherens tasks with participants in an ongoing study about risky behavior and environmental factors.
active engagement and participation in research

I gained skills in interviewing and screening potential participants and evaluating their fit with the study we were running. I gained insight on the mechanisms of disinhibition, and gained insight on the psychology research process through lab meetings.
Research skills, presentation skills, writing skills, critical analysis
I learned a lot about working with kids and administrative tasks.
I learnt more research skills, and what its like to work in a lab.
Psychology behavioral coding
Research skills, reading comprehension of scientific articles, and a better understanding of how research is conducted in the field of psychology.

I was able to participate in research for the first time and got to experience the requisite skills firsthand. I really enjoyed the process of getting to know how studies are conducted behind the scenes and working with participants to further knowledge on an interesting research topic. Working with fellow research assistants as well as the overseeing grad students was also very rewarding.
It was incredibly valuable to work on current research  its an experience you wont have just taking a class. I worked at the Yale Center for Emotional Intelligence, which was amazing.

I learned how psychology research is conducted at a graduate level and really got to observe the inner workings of what goes into a good research experiment/the process that leads to a published behavioral studies paper
Further experience with the Leonard learning lab

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I love the mod lab!! It gave me great hands on experience for research.
This course allowed my to get real experience in a lab and experience with the research process. There were no weaknesses.
Just strengths! I loved working with Dr. Fernandes, she was so supportive and I learned so much.
I thought the lab could have been slightly more social, but other than that it was great!
There were points at which it was difficult to gather enough participants to run data, but when running participants all went smoothly

- strength: I loved the flexibility this course provides and how it is uniquely designed for students to understand the research process 
- weakness: none

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, I thought working in a psychology lab was the best way to get the most out of my degree.
yes
Yes, because you will learn about the research process in your field of interest and gain a faculty-student connection as well.
Yes you learn lots of applicable skills
Yes. It's a great way to get a credit while learning about developmental psychology through direct work.
Yes, to anyone interested in research
Absolutely! For anyone who is curious about psychology and wants to consider research for their future, directed research is a must-try
